plan:
1. Initial Rounds (1-5): Bid exactly my value. This helps gather data on other bidders' strategies.
2. Middle Rounds (6-10): Implement aggressive strategy, bid slightly higher than my value (10% extra), to test if I can win more auctions.
3. Final Rounds (11-15): Based on previous data, if I'm consistently outbid, I'll reduce my bid to minimize losses. If I'm winning, I'll continue with aggressive strategy but adjust the extra percentage based on the average winning bid.

1. Low Risk Strategy: For the first 5 rounds, bid half of the value. Gather data on opponents' bidding behavior.

2. Aggressive Strategy: For the next 5 rounds, bid the full value to observe opponents' reactions and gather data on high bid situations.

3. Calculated Risk Strategy: For the final 5 rounds, based on the data collected, bid strategically to maximize profit. This could involve bidding just above the average bid of opponents when my value is high, or low bids when my value is low.

Plan: 

1. Round 1-3: Bid low (below $30) to gather initial data on competitors' bidding behavior.
2. Round 4-6: Increase bids (between $30-$60) to test competitors' reactions and observe if they tend to overbid.
3. Round 7-9: Bid aggressively (above $60) to test risk tolerance and potentially secure high-value prizes.
4. Round 10-12: Based on previous rounds' data, adapt strategy. If competitors overbid, bid low to conserve resources. If they bid conservatively, bid high to win prizes.

Continue bidding my value for data collection. Analyze other bidders' patterns to predict their bids. In middle rounds, bid 10% higher than my value. In final rounds, adjust strategy based on previous rounds' results, either minimizing losses or maintaining an aggressive approach.

Continue with the Low Risk Strategy for the next 4 rounds. Observe opponents' bidding patterns to determine the average bid. Begin the Aggressive Strategy in round 6, adjusting based on the observed average bid.

Plan: Continue bidding low (below $30) for round 1-3. Observe competitors' behavior. From round 4-6, gradually increase bids ($30-$60). If competitors overbid, revert to low bids. If they bid conservatively, escalate bids above $60 in rounds 7-9. Adapt strategy in rounds 10-12 based on data.

For rounds 2-5, continue bidding my value. In rounds 6-10, bid 10% over my value to potentially win more auctions. In rounds 11-15, adjust strategy based on previous results, either minimizing losses or maintaining an aggressive approach.

Continue with Low Risk Strategy for rounds 2-4. Observe opponents' average bids. From round 5, switch to Aggressive Strategy, bidding full value. Adjust strategy in final rounds based on collected data, aiming to bid just above opponents' average when value is high, and low when value is low.

Plan: In rounds 2-3, continue low bids (below $30) to gather data. From rounds 4-6, increase bids ($30-$60) to test reactions. If competitors overbid, bid low in rounds 7-9. If they underbid, bid aggressively in rounds 10-12 to secure high-value prizes. Adjust based on competitors' behavior.

For rounds 3-5, continue bidding my value. In rounds 6-10, bid 10% over my value. If consistently outbid, reduce bids in rounds 11-15. If winning, maintain aggressive strategy but adjust the extra percentage. Analyze other bidders' patterns to predict their bids and adjust strategy accordingly.

Continue Low Risk Strategy for round 3, bidding half value. In round 4, test a moderate bid, around 75% of value. Switch to Aggressive Strategy in round 5, bidding full value. In final rounds, adjust bids based on opponents' average, aiming to maximize profit.

Plan: For rounds 3-5, increase bids to $40-$60 range to gauge competitors' responses. If they consistently overbid, conserve resources by bidding low in rounds 6-8. If they underbid, bid aggressively ($70-$90) in rounds 9-11 to secure high-value prizes. Adapt strategy for final rounds based on observed patterns.

For rounds 4-5, continue bidding my value. In rounds 6-10, bid 10% over my value. In rounds 11-15, adjust strategy based on previous results, either minimizing losses or maintaining an aggressive approach. Analyze other bidders' patterns to predict their bids and adjust strategy accordingly.

For the next round, I'll stick to the Low Risk Strategy, bidding half my value. In round 5, I'll switch to the Aggressive Strategy, bidding full value. In the final rounds, I'll adjust my bids based on opponents' average bids, aiming to maximize profit.

Plan: Increase bids to $60-$70 range in rounds 4-6 to examine competitors' counters. If they overbid, bid low in rounds 7-9 to conserve resources. If they underbid, bid aggressively ($80-$99) in rounds 10-12 to secure high-value prizes. Adjust final rounds strategy based on observed patterns.

In rounds 5-7, maintain bidding my value. In rounds 8-10, bid 10% above my value. Analyze previous rounds, if consistently outbid, reduce bid in rounds 11-15. If winning, maintain aggressive strategy but adjust the extra percentage.

In the next round, I'll implement the Aggressive Strategy, bidding my full value. This will help me assess opponents' reactions to high bids. In the final rounds, I'll employ a Calculated Risk Strategy, adjusting my bids based on opponents' average to maximize profit.

Plan: Continue with $60-$70 bids in round 5. In round 6, bid aggressively ($80-$99) if competitors underbid. If they overbid, lower bids ($40-$60). From round 7-9, adjust strategy based on competitors' behavior. In final rounds, bid close to second highest bid to maximize profit.

For rounds 6-10, I'll bid 10% above my value to potentially win more auctions. In rounds 11-15, I'll adjust my strategy based on previous results - if consistently outbid, I'll reduce my bids; if winning, I'll maintain the aggressive strategy but fine-tune the extra percentage.

In round 6-10, I'll implement the Aggressive Strategy, bidding full value. This will help assess opponents' reactions to high bids. In the final rounds, I'll employ a Calculified Risk Strategy, adjusting bids based on opponents' average to maximize profit.

Plan: For rounds 6-8, bid conservatively ($30-$50) to conserve resources and observe competitors' behavior. If they underbid, bid aggressively ($70-$99) in rounds 9-11. In the final rounds, adapt strategy to bid close to second highest bid to maximize profit.

Continue bidding 10% above my value in rounds 7-10. In rounds 11-15, if consistently winning, maintain aggressive strategy but reduce extra percentage to 5%. If consistently outbid, bid 5% below value to minimize losses. Analyze other bidders' patterns to adjust strategy accordingly.

In rounds 7-10, continue the Aggressive Strategy, bidding full value. Analyze opponents' patterns. In the final rounds, implement a Modified Risk Strategy, bidding around 70% of value when it's high, and low when it's low, to balance winning chances and profit.

Plan: For rounds 7-9, bid aggressively ($70-$99) if competitors underbid in previous rounds. If they overbid, conserve resources by bidding low ($30-$50). In rounds 10-12, adjust strategy based on observed patterns, bidding close to second highest bid to maximize profit.

In rounds 8-10, continue bidding 10% above value. In rounds 11-13, if consistently winning, reduce extra percentage to 5%. If consistently outbid, bid 5% below value. In rounds 14-15, adjust strategy based on previous rounds, aiming for optimal balance between risk and profit.

Continue Aggressive Strategy in rounds 8-10, bidding full value. Analyze opponents' patterns. For final rounds, implement Modified Risk Strategy, bidding around 70% of high value, and low for low value, balancing winning chances and profit. Adjust strategy based on opponents' average bids.

Plan: For rounds 8-10, bid moderately ($40-$60) to balance risk and reward. If competitors consistently overbid, bid low ($20-$30) in rounds 11-13 to conserve resources. If they underbid, bid aggressively ($70-$99) in the final rounds to maximize potential profits.

For rounds 9-10, continue bidding 10% above value. In rounds 11-13, if winning, lower extra percentage to 5%. If outbid, bid 5% below value. In rounds 14-15, adjust strategy based on results, balancing risk and profit. Consider bidding closer to value to maximize profit.

For rounds 9-10, continue Aggressive Strategy, bidding full value. Analyze opponents' patterns. For final rounds, implement Modified Risk Strategy, bidding around 70% of value when high, low for low value. Adjust strategy based on opponents' average bids.

Plan: For rounds 9-11, bid closer to my value to minimize losses. If competitors consistently overbid, bid low ($10-$20). If they underbid, bid moderately ($40-$60) in the last rounds. Adjust strategy based on observed patterns to optimize profit.

For rounds 10-12, I'll bid 5% above my value, reducing the risk while remaining competitive. For rounds 13-15, I'll adjust my strategy based on the outcomes of previous rounds - if consistently outbid, I'll bid my exact value; if winning, I'll maintain the slightly aggressive strategy.

For rounds 10-12, continue Aggressive Strategy, bidding full value. Analyze opponents' patterns. For final rounds 13-15, implement Modified Risk Strategy, bidding around 70% of value when high, low for low value. Adjust strategy based on opponents' average bids.

Plan: For rounds 10-12, continue bidding close to my value to minimize losses. If competitors consistently overbid, bid low ($10-$20). If they underbid, bid moderately ($40-$60). In the final rounds, adapt strategy to bid slightly above second highest bid to maximize profit.

For rounds 11-13, I'll bid my exact value to minimize losses. For rounds 14-15, I'll adjust my strategy based on previous outcomes - if consistently outbid, I'll bid 5% less than my value; if winning, I'll maintain bidding my value.

Continue Aggressive Strategy for round 11, bidding full value. For final rounds 12-15, apply Modified Risk Strategy, bidding 70% of high value, low for low value. Adjust strategy based on opponents' average bids, aiming to bid slightly lower than my high value to increase profits.

Plan: For rounds 11-13, bid slightly above my value (5-10%) when value is high (>65) to secure wins. If value is low (<30), bid very conservatively (10-20%) to minimize losses. In final rounds, adjust strategy based on competitors' behavior to optimize profit.

For rounds 12-13, I'll bid my exact value to minimize losses. For rounds 14-15, I'll adjust my strategy - if consistently outbid, I'll bid 5% less than my value; if winning, I'll maintain bidding my value.

For the next rounds, I'll employ a Modified Risk Strategy, bidding 70% of high value and low for low value. I'll also consider bidding slightly lower than my high value to increase profits, based on opponents' average bids.

Plan: For rounds 12-13, bid aggressively (70-90%) when value is high (>60) to secure wins. If value is low (<30), bid conservatively (20-40%) to minimize losses. In final round, adjust bid based on competitors' behavior, aiming to slightly outbid second highest bid to maximize profit.

For rounds 13-14, I'll bid my exact value. In the final round, I'll underbid by $1 if I've been consistently winning. If outbid, I'll overbid by $1. I'll adjust based on previous outcomes, balancing risk and potential profit.

For rounds 13-15, I'll implement a Balanced Risk Strategy, bidding 60% of high value, and conservatively for low value. I'll adjust my bids based on opponents' average, aiming to bid slightly lower than my high value to increase profits.

Plan: In round 13, bid aggressively (80-90%) if value is high (>60). If value is low (<30), bid conservatively (20-40%). For final rounds, adjust strategy to bid slightly above second highest bid from previous rounds to maximize profit.

In round 14, I'll bid my value, observing the results. In the final round, I'll implement a new strategy: if consistently winning, I'll underbid by $1 to maximize profit; if outbid, I'll overbid by $1 to secure a win.

For the final round, I'll implement a Conservative Strategy, bidding 40% of high value and minimally for low value. This strategy aims to minimize losses, considering my current negative profit. I'll adjust my bid based on opponents' average, aiming to bid competitively yet profitably.

Plan: In round 14, bid conservatively (20-40%) if value is low (<30). If value is high (>60), bid aggressively (70-90%). For final round 15, adjust bid to slightly above second highest bid from previous rounds to secure win and maximize profit.
